author: .vbuterin
content: I forget, what is people's thinking here on address space *compression* instead of expansion?

author: .vbuterin
content: This is the "choose a 4 byte prefix, ban it today, later make it required for nonzero-period addresses" route

author: .vbuterin
content: So addresses stay within the 20 byte range, but the tradeoff is that you lose collision resistance

author: .vbuterin
content: Though it turns out that collision resistance is only required for some very narrow use cases

author: .vbuterin
content: <@!420501213327392770> you had thoughts here too I think?
